text:
Remember Rebecca Black!?

The singer went viral back in 2011 with song and music video called, "Friday." It may not have been a hit, but it did have EVERYONE talking. But not all the comments were kind.

"After it went on the Internet, it literally blew up in the blink of an eye. The hate comments were everywhere. No one can prep you for that kind of a thing," Rebecca shared with the camera. "There is something so brutal when you're 13 about people telling you that you don't belong here. There was definitely a moment where I got really close to giving up on my music."

Well Black is all grown up now, and wants to be taken as a serious artist. Thursday night she auditioned on The Four! She sang Natalie Imbruglia's "Torn," and a special rendition of NSYNC's classic hit "Bye, Bye, Bye."

Spoiler alert: She sounded so good! And the judges loved it! They allowed her to challenge a fellow singer, but Black was ultimately sent home.

The Four airs Thursday nights at 8 p.m. only on Fox.
title: Watch Rebecca Black Audition For 'The Four' And She Sings Great!
